sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
It is given that two numbers are in the ratio \(5 : 6 \). If 4 is added to each of the numbers, the ratio becomes \(17 : 20 \). Then find the numbers
\newline
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "$$\text{
Since the numbers are in the ratio $6 : 5 $, we can take them as $6 b $, and $5 b $.
According to give information, we can write}$$
\[
	(\input[s1v1]{} b + 4 ):(6 b + 4 ) = \input[s1v2]{} : 20 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{5 b + 4 }{6 b + 4 } = \frac{17 }{20 }
\]
"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow 100 b + \input[s3v1]{} = \input[s3v2]{} b + 68 
\]
"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	b = \frac{68 - \input[s4v1]{} }{\input[s4v2]{} - 102 }
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "

\[
	b = \frac{\input[s5v1]{} }{-2 }
\]
"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[b = \input[s6v1]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{
So, first number is $5 (b ) = \input[s7v1]{} $
Second number is $ 6 (b ) = 36 $
\newline}$$
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [5, 17], "text": "$$\text{Given the ratio $6 : 5 $, the two numbers can be expressed as $b 6$ and $b 5$, thus, their sum and ratio can be written as }$$\[
	(5 b + 4 ):(6 b + 4 ) = 17 : 20 
\]

"}, {"data": [], "text": " 
"}, {"data": [80, 102], "text": "$$\text{Cross Multiplying both sides we get the following equation}$$ \[
	 100 b + 80 = 100 b + 68
\] "}, {"data": [80, 100], "text": "$$\text{Taking constant terms on one side, and variable terms on other side, and then dividing the result of the constant term by the difference in coefficients of variable we get}$$ \[
	b = \frac{68 - 80 }{100 - 102 }
\]"}, {"data": [-12], "text": "$$\text{
Solving the subtraction we get}$$
 \[ b = \frac{-12 }{-2 }
\]
"}, {"data": [6], "text": "$$\text{Dividing both the numerator and denominator by their greatest common divisor we get}$$ \[ b = 6
\]
"}, {"data": [30], "text": " $$\text{Putting the value of $ b = 6 $ in $5 b $, and $6 b $, we get the numbers as 30 and 36.}$$
"}]
